Package nzilbb.ag

Class ChangeTracker

  • Object
    • ChangeTracker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Consumer<Change>
    public class ChangeTracker
extends Object
implements Consumer<Change>
    Something that listens for Changes to TrackedMap objects.
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz

      • getOthers

        public LinkedHashSet<Consumer<Change>> getOthers()
        Getter for others: Consumers to pass the events to.
        Returns:
        Consumers to pass the events to.

      • setOthers

        public ChangeTracker setOthers​(LinkedHashSet<Consumer<Change>> newOthers)
        Setter for others: Consumers to pass the events to.
        Parameters:
        newOthers - Consumers to pass the events to.

      • accept

        public void accept​(Change change)
        Register a TrackedMap object Change.
        Specified by:
        accept in interface Consumer<Change>
        Parameters:
        change - The change, which includes information about the object that is changing, which attribute, what the old value was, and what the new value is.

      • reject

        public void reject​(Change change)
        De-register a TrackedMap object Change.
        Parameters:
        change - The change, which should have been previously registered via accept(Change).

      • getChange

        public Optional<Change> getChange​(String id,
                                  String key)
        Gets all the changes for the given attribute of the given object.
        Parameters:
        id - The TrackedMap.getId() of the changed object.
        key - The key of the changed attribute, or null for Create/Destroy changes.
        Returns:
        A (possibly empty) set of changes that were registered.

      • getChanges

        public Set<Change> getChanges​(String id)
        Gets all the changes for the identified object.
        Parameters:
        id - The TrackedMap.getId() of the changed object.
        Returns:
        A (possibly empty) set of changes that were registered.

      • hasChanges

        public boolean hasChanges()
        Determines whether there are any changes.
        Returns:
        true if there are any changes registered, false otherwise.

      • getChanges

        public Set<Change> getChanges()
        Gets all the changes.
        Returns:
        A (possibly empty) set of changes that were registered.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Clear all tracked changes. After calling this, previously registered changes cannot be rolled back.

      • addListener

        public void addListener​(Consumer<Change> other)
        Add another consumer to also receive the changes.
        Parameters:
        other -

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener​(Consumer<Change> other)
        Stop a registered consumer receiving further the changes.
        Parameters:
        other -
